module.title: Favicon
module.desc: Upload a Favicon to be included with your site. It is the 16x16 pixels icon you see on the top left of the browser URL

module.title: Enable Tagline
module.desc: Check box to display your tagline which is set in the Wordpress General Settings.

module.title: Font Size
module.desc: All sizes are in pixels. No need to add "px" at the end.

module.title: Font Family
module.desc: Select the font family for your tagline.

module.title: Font Color
module.desc: Select the color for your tagline.

module.title: Font Weight
module.desc: Select the font weight for your tagline.

module.title: Font Style
module.desc: Select the font style for your tagline.

module.title: Use Image or Text
module.desc: Select to use an image logo or a text logo

module.title: Logo
module.desc: Upload a logo for your theme, or specify the image address of your online logo. (http://yoursite.com/logo.png) Preferred size 198x80

module.title: Text Logo Alt Text
module.desc: To be in compliance of the W3C code standard, ALT tags are used to describe the image and what it does.

module.title: Site Title
module.desc: Enter your site name here

module.title: Font Size
module.desc: All sizes are in pixels. No need to add "px" at the end.

module.title: Font Family
module.desc: Select the font family for your text logo.

module.title: Font Color
module.desc: Select the color for your text logo.

module.title: Font Weight
module.desc: Select the font weight for your logo.

module.title: Font Style
module.desc: Select the font style for your logo.

module.title: Site Title on Hover
module.desc: Select the text color when mouse hovers over the logo text.

module.title: Image Crop Option
module.desc: Select the way you want your images to be cropped. The direction you select is the direction it will start the crop from (Default is center out)

module.title: Zoom and Crop
module.desc: Select the appropriate zoom and crop options for your images. 0 - Resize to Fit specified dimensions (no cropping). 1 - Crop and resize to best fit the dimensions (default behaviour). 2 - Resize proportionally to fit entire image into specified dimensions, and add borders if required. 3 - Resize proportionally adjusting size of scaled image so there are no borders gaps. (default is 1)

module.title: Image Quality Level
module.desc: Select the image compression level you desire. The higher the number the better the image quality but bigger filesize and the lower the number the lower the image quality but smaller filesize. (default is 90).

module.title: Image Sharpening
module.desc: Check box to enable image sharpening (default is disabled).

module.title: Image Background Canvas Color
module.desc: Pick the color you want for the background canvas color. This is used when your images are cropped and it does not fill the entire image container. (default is not set)

module.title: Image Filters
module.desc: Select the different image filter effects you can use (default is none).

module.title: Image PNG Transparency
module.desc: Check box to enable PNG image transparency when you're using a PNG image and want the background to be transparent. (default is disabled).

module.title: Image Crop Option
module.desc: Select the way you want your images to be cropped. The direction you select is the direction it will start the crop from (Default is center out)

module.title: Zoom and Crop
module.desc: Select the appropriate zoom and crop options for your images. 0 - Resize to Fit specified dimensions (no cropping). 1 - Crop and resize to best fit the dimensions (default behaviour). 2 - Resize proportionally to fit entire image into specified dimensions, and add borders if required. 3 - Resize proportionally adjusting size of scaled image so there are no borders gaps. (default is 1)

module.desc: Select the image compression level you desire. The higher the number the better the image quality but bigger filesize and the lower the number the lower the image quality but smaller filesize. (default is 90).

module.title: Image Filters

module.title: Image PNG Transparency
module.desc: Check box to enable PNG image transparency when you're using a PNG image and want the background to be transparent. (default is disabled).

module.title: Turn On Mobile Ready
module.desc: Check box to enable your theme to be mobile ready. This makes your theme responsive.

module.title: Enable Zooming
module.desc: Check box to enable zooming capabilities on mobile devices (default is ON). Turning this off will fix the issue of when the device is rotated, the site is initially zoomed in effect. When off, it will also prevent users from pinch to zoom.

module.title: Copyright Text
module.desc: Enter your copyright information.
module.std: Copyright © Splashing Pixels, All Rights Reserved

module.title: Font Size
module.desc: All sizes are in pixels. No need to add "px" at the end.

module.title: Font Family
module.desc: Select the font family for your copyright text.

module.title: Font Color
module.desc: Select the color for your copyright text.

module.title: Font Weight
module.desc: Select the font weight for your copyright text.

module.title: Font Style
module.desc: Select the font style for your copyright text.

module.title: Footer Post Rotator Count
module.desc: Select the number of posts you would like to rotate.

module.title: Footer Post Rotator Interval
module.desc: Select the number of seconds you want inbetween each post change. (default is off)

module.title: Show Related Posts
module.desc: Check box to display related posts in the single post page

module.title: Custom Text
module.desc: Enter the custom title text you would like to show for the Related Post section. (default Related Posts)

module.title: Select Pagination Style
module.desc: Select the type of pagination style you want for your blog posts. One is paginated by numeration and the other is by next and previous post or posts. You can also turn all pagination off. (default is next and previous posts)

module.title: Sidebar Orientation
module.desc: Select the sidebar orientation you want to display (default is right)

module.title: Sidebar Orientation
module.desc: Select the sidebar orientation you want to display (default is right)

module.title: Sidebar Orientation
module.desc: Select the sidebar orientation you want to display (default is right)

module.title: RSS Feed URL
module.desc: (Optional) Enter the RSS feed URL if you\'re not using the Wordpress standard feeds. (i.e. Google Feed Burner). This will redirect your feed URL site wide to the one you have set.

module.title: Enable RSS Icon
module.desc: Check box to enable the RSS Icon throughout the site.

module.title: Enable Google Plus One Button
module.desc: Check box to enable button for your posts and products.

module.title: Enable Counter
module.desc: Check box to enable a counter for the button.

module.title: Size
module.desc: Choose the size of the button. (Tall mode will always show a counter)

module.title: Enable Google Plus Icon
module.desc: Check box to enable your Google Plus Profile to be associated with Google Plus icons througout the site.

module.title: Google Plus Profile URL
module.desc: Enter your Google Plus Profile URL (i.e http://plus.google.com/115445554083854323481).

module.title: Enable Facebook Like Button
module.desc: Check box to enable Facebook "like" button for your posts. (This will appear at the bottom of each post)

module.title: Enable Facebook
module.desc: Check box to enable your Facebook account to be associated with Facebook icons throughout the site.

module.title: Facebook Account
module.desc: Enter your Facebook account name (i.e. http://facebook.com/splashingpixels).

module.title: Facebook Open Graph on Products
module.desc: Check box to enable Facebook Open Graph feature where if someone clicks on your LIKE button, your product information - including image of the product will be displayed on their Facebook page

module.title: Item Type
module.desc: Type in the product type of the products you which to feature. Please refer to the custom type you created in your open graph app.

module.title: App ID
module.desc: Enter the ID of the app

module.title: Admin ID
module.desc: Enter the ID of the admin for the Facebook page

module.title: Enable Twitter
module.desc: Check box to enable your Twitter account to be associated with Twitter icons throughout the site.

module.title: Twitter Account
module.desc: Enter your Twitter account name (i.e. http://twitter.com/splashingpixels)..

module.title: Enable Pinterest Icon
module.desc: Check box to enable your Pinterest Profile to be associated with Pinterest icons througout the site.

module.title: Pinterest Profile Name
module.desc: Enter your Pinterest Profile URL (i.e http://pinterest.com/splashingpixels/).

module.title: Enable Flickr
module.desc: Check box to enable your Flickr account to be associated with Flickr icons throughout the site.

module.title: Flickr Account
module.desc: Enter your Flickr account name (i.e. http://flickr.com/photos/splashingpixels).

module.title: Enable YouTube Icon
module.desc: Check box to enable your YouTube Profile to be associated with YouTube icons througout the site.

module.title: YouTube Profile Name
module.desc: Enter your YouTube Profile URL (i.e http://youtube.com/user/splashingpixels/).

module.title: Enable Social Tools
module.desc: Check box to enable Twitter and Facebook Like button to show on lightbox.

module.title: Lightbox Theme
module.desc: Select the lightbox style you want to use.

module.title: Lightbox Slideshow
module.desc: Checkbox to enable lightbox image slideshow feature.

module.title: Lightbox Gallery Thumnails
module.desc: Check box to enable gallery thumbnails within the lightbox.

module.title: Lightbox Title
module.desc: Check box to display title within the lightbox.

module.title: Footer Widget Configuration
module.desc: Select the footer widget configuration you prefer. (Default is Off)

module.title: Enable Sitewide Widgets
module.desc: Checkbox to enable sitewide widgets. This is a global setting. You may override this per page/post.

module.title: Create Widgets for Page
module.desc: Select the page you want to create custom widgets for

module.title: Create Widgets for Blog Category
module.desc: Select the blog category you want to create custom widgets for

module.title: Create Widgets for Product Category
module.desc: Select the product category you want to create custom widgets for

module.title: Create Widgets for Product Category
module.desc: Select the product category you want to create custom widgets for

module.title: Meta Keywords
module.desc: Enter the keywords for your site. (Separate each keyword with a comma)

module.title: Meta Description
module.desc: Enter the site description.

module.title: Set Custom Backend Login Logo
module.desc: Upload the logo you want to display for the backend login section

module.title: Paste Code
module.desc: Paste the Google Analytics code provided to you in your Google Analytics account.

module.title: Header Custom Script Code
module.desc: Enter your custom JS script here to be loaded in your head section. (Do not include the script tags as they are already added for you)

module.title: Footer Custom Script Code
module.desc: Enter your custom JS script here to be loaded in your footer section. (Do not include the script tags as they are already added for you)

module.title: Reset All Theme Settings
module.desc: This will reset all options to their default values.

module.title: Empty Image Cache Folder
module.desc: This will clear out your Timthumb cached images that are on your site in case you have lingering items.

module.title: Clear all product star ratings
module.desc: This will clear ALL of the product star ratings.

module.title: Hide Update Notification
module.desc: Check box to hide the system theme and framework update notification
Here are 2 predefined skin styles to choose from.

module.title: Skin
module.desc: Select your skin. Changing the skin will change the theme stylesheet.

module.title: Custom Backgrounds
module.desc: Select a custom background for your site.

module.title: Upload Custom Background
module.desc: Click upload to choose the background image you want to use site wide.

module.title: Image Position
module.desc: Choose the position you want your image to start with (i.e. if you choose left, your image will start from the very left edge).

module.title: Image Repeat
module.desc: Choose how you want your image to be repeated if using a repeatable tile image. (i.e. if you choose repeat-x, this will repeat your image left to right).

module.title: Background Attachment
module.desc: Select the effect you want your image to have whether it scrolls with the page or fixed in place

module.title: Background Color
module.desc: Choose a background color for your site. This color compliments the background design you chose if the design is semi-opaque, this background color setting will show through or if your background design does not fill the screen, this background color will fill the rest.

module.title: Slider Effects
module.desc: Select the slider effects you want to use. Please note some setting works in combination with the direction setting and may not all be compatible.

module.title: Slider Direction
module.desc: Select the direction you want the slide to go on transtion. Please note only left and right works with responsive layout.

module.title: Auto Time Interval
module.desc: Choose the amount of time in seconds between slide changes. (default is OFF)

module.title: Slide Transition Speed
module.desc: Type in the number in seconds you would like the animation speed to be. (1000 for 1 second -- 200 for 200 milisecond)

module.title: Easing
module.desc: Select the easing effect you want when slider transitions in.

module.title: Enable Touch Swipe
module.desc: Check box to enable touch devices to be able to swipe on the carousel to rotate the slides.

module.title: Featured Product 1
module.desc: Select the product you want to feature.

module.title: Featured Product 2
module.desc: Select the product you want to feature.

module.title: Featured Product 3
module.desc: Select the product you want to feature.

module.title: Text Character Cut Off Point
module.desc: Type in the number in characters that you would like the product description text to be. (i.e. if set to 500, the cut off will happen after 500 characters.)

module.title: Denote Character
module.desc: Type in the characters you would like to use to denote more product description text is available. (i.e. ...)

wrapper.title: Featured Product on Product Page Options

module.title: Text Character Cut Off Point
module.desc: Type in the number in characters that you would like the featured product description to be. (i.e. if set to 230, the cut off will happen after 230 characters.)

module.title: Denote Character
module.desc: Type in the characters you would like to use to denote more description text is available. (i.e. ...)

module.title: Product View
module.desc: Choose your prefered product view.

module.title: Display Sale Tag
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of the "Sale Tag" on products that are on sale!

module.title: Show Product Image Gallery
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of multiple product gallery images under the main product image.

module.title: Product Multi Image Swap
module.desc: Check box to enable product multi image swap for multiview product images. If off, clicking on multi image thumbnail will open a lightbox. (default is ON)

module.title: Product Variation Image Swap
module.desc: Check box to enable the main product image to be swapped with the variation image when selected.

module.title: Enable Product View Buttons
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of product views where users can click between grid or list view.

module.title: Enable Custom Meta Fields
module.desc: Check box to enable custom meta fields display on single products page

module.title: Collapse Tabs on Load
module.desc: Check box to enable information tabs on the single products page to start in a collapsed state.

module.title: Cross Sales Custom Text
module.desc: Type the verbiage you want to appear for your product cross sale section
module.std: People who bought this item also bought:

module.title: Turn On Product Review
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of product review comments globally for all products.

module.title: Products Per Page
module.desc: Enter the number of products per page you would like to show before displaying pagination.

module.title: Account Login/Create Form
module.desc: Check box to enable the optional account login/creation form on checkout page and account page.

module.title: Turn on Icon
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of the secured icon on the checkout page. This will give customers a sense of security when purchasing from your site. Due note that this is not to substitute a real SSL certificate.

module.title: Upload SSL Image
module.desc: Upload the SSL image provided by your SSL provider.

module.title: SSL Code
module.desc: Paste the script code provided by your SSL provider to display the secured image/icon. Take note that this will take precedence over the uploaded SSL image.

wrapper.title: Related Products and Up Sale Products

module.title: Set Number of Related Products to Display
module.desc: Enter the number of related products you want to display on the single products page

module.title: Related Product Custom Text
module.desc: Type the title verbiage you want to appear for your related product section

module.title: Set Number of Upsell Products to Display
module.desc: Enter the number of upsell products you want to display on the single products page

module.title: Upsell Product Custom Text
module.desc: Type the title verbiage you want to appear for your upsell product section

module.title: Enable Product Ratings
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of product rating stars. Note that it is only for the display and have no relation to the product reviews.

module.title: Enable Description Tab
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of the product description tab in the single product detail page.

module.title: Enable Attribute Tab
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of the product attribute tab in the single product detail page.

module.title: Enable Product Review Tab
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of the product review tab in the single product detail page.

module.title: Turn on Icon
module.desc: Check box to enable the display of the secured icon on the checkout page. This will give customers a sense of security when purchasing from your site. Due note that this is not to substitute a real SSL certificate.

module.desc: Upload the SSL image provided by your SSL provider.

module.title: SSL Code
module.desc: Paste the script code provided by your SSL provider to display the secured image/icon. Take note that this will take precedence over the uploaded SSL image.

module.title: Help! Every page is going to page not found!
module.answer: Go to Wordpress settings->permalinks and click on save TWICE.

module.title: Product pages don't seem to be using the theme style.
module.answer: Go to Wordpress settings->store->presentation tab and on the right hand side, click on flush theme cache.

module.title: I don't see additional images in quickview or in single product view.
module.answer: First make sure you have Gold Cart plugin installed and activated. Also make sure you have entered your API key and username for the plugin in Wordpress dashboard->store upgrades. Then make sure you have turned on "show thumbnail gallery".

module.title: None of the images on the site are displaying.
module.answer: First check to see what permission your timthumb cache folder is set to. Go to your theme folder->sp-framework->timthumb->cache. That folder needs to be set to either 755 or 777 depending on your host. If trying both and it does not work then check with your host if Timthumb script is allowed by default. If no, ask them to put it on whitelist. After doing that if it still doesn't work, ask your host if GD library is installed on your PHP. Also note that Timthumb script will have trouble finding your images if you're under a temporary site url such as http://hostingserver.com/~username. If you fall under this category, then all you need to do is get a parked domain and point your domain nameservers to your hosting account and have them set it to this parked domain temporarily so you can work on the site.

module.title: How do I update the theme and framework?
module.answer: Go to your Splashing Pixels member dashboard by logging in. Download the latest version of your theme. Be sure to backup your existing site files and database prior to updating. It is also best practice to update it on a test/staging server prior to your live site. Unzip the newly downloaded zip file which now you should see your theme folder. Within this folder consists of the framework as well. Using a FTP program login to your site via FTP. Put the contents of the theme folder to your current site's theme folder. So the path should like similar to this /public_html/wp-content/themes/yourtheme/.

module.title: How do I customize the CSS without it being overwritten on updates?
module.answer: If you're just manipulating the CSS, simply create a file called custom_styles.css and place this file inside the theme folder root level. The theme will know to look into this file for any styles you may wish to add or change.

module.title: How come some product or blog post images are displaying an icon with a shopping basket that says no image available?
module.answer: When you see this image, that means you have not set an image for the product or featured image for the blog post.

module.title: Help! I seem to lost all the image size settings in the presentation tab.
module.answer: First try going to the theme options->general settings->reset settings->reset all settings. If this does not reset all image sizes, then you can manually input them by opening the file config.xml within your theme folder and scrolling all the way down to the bottom and you should see the default image sizes for the whole theme.

module.title: I setup a category but when I click on it to see the products, it goes somewhere else!
module.answer: Wordpress is very sensitive to slugs when using permalinks. So be sure you're NOT naming for example a blog category Products and also a product category named Products. By doing this Wordpress will get confused and not display as expected. Don't confuse slugs with titles. Titles can have the same name but not slugs. Slugs is what you see in the permalink URL in the address bar. In addition, make sure there are no duplicates even if they are in the trash. You must also clear your trash for this to work.

module.title: What the heck is this SP HOME page your theme created?
module.answer: SP HOME is what drives your theme homepage and is IMPORTANT so please don't delete this. Also make sure in your settings->reading you have Frontpage displays set to SP HOME. Don't worry too much about the title SP HOME, you can name this whatever you want. You may ask why this was not named HOME from the beginning. That's because we are forward thinking people and considered and did not want to inadvertently delete a page in your site that is already named HOME when you installed our theme.

module.title: I am stuck on a certain view settings, what gives?
module.answer: First don't panic, let me explain. Ok there are 3 views, list/default/grid...That is what WPEC plugin names them but it's actually kind of confusing. The icon switcher is for ONLY default/grid but take note, default is actually called list in the icon switcher. List in the system of WPEC is more for wholesalers...90% of people will only use default/grid. Whatever you set up your settings to be IS what people will see by default. Once they click on the switcher, it will remember each user's settings from page to page so it is very likely you see something different from the next guy. But just know what you set in the backend settings is the default of what they see first if they have never been to your site.

module.title: What is this SP Truncate box in my post settings?
module.answer: This truncate function allows you to customize how many characters you want to display in the excerpt view/blog list view. Along with that, you can choose to set a denote character to hint there are more information and to set whether you want to cut the characters exactly or to perserve whole word. This is really an awesome feature as you can set different levels of text post by post control!

module.title: My theme settings does not seem to be saving!
module.answer: First check that when you click on the SAVE button, you see the spinning logo and a checkmark indicating your changes have been saved. If you do see the spinning logo and checkmark but it still doesn't save, check if you have other conflicting plugins by deactivating one by one to see which one is the culprit. If you do not see the checkmark but instead see the no can do sign, then try logging out and logging back in as this will flush your authentication.

module.title: How come my images are blurry!?
module.answer: First check the settings within the theme options->global image options. This area sets the quality of the images being shown amount many other options. If after checking these settings propely and you're still getting blurry images, it could mean your image resolution size is too small. A general size to have for your images before uploading is around 800x800. You don't want it to small or too large.

add_page.name: SP Home
add_page.content: This is a textarea which you can input your welcome message if you like. The page to edit is "SP HOME"
